rows.title: Home practise reminder

text.eng:
Hey there! üëã Just checking in with a friendly reminder to try this week‚Äôs home activity:

Spend a few minutes of One-on-One Time with your child‚Äîno distractions, just the two of you!

Here‚Äôs something to keep in mind:
Even short moments of focused attention help your child feel truly seen and loved. It strengthens your bond and reminds them that what they do is important. üíñ

You‚Äôre doing great‚Äîkeep it up!

rows.title: Chat session reminder

text.eng: Hello! I look forward to hearing how the rest of your week goes when we next meet on [ENTER DATE HERE]. Chat then!

guidance.eng: Replace [ENTER DATE HERE] with the date of the chat session

rows.text: Hello! I look forward to hearing how the rest of your week goes when we next meet on [ENTER DATE HERE]. Chat then!
rows.guidance: Replace [ENTER DATE HERE] with the date of the chat session

rows.title: Message 1: Welcome

text.eng: Hello and thanks for being part of the@global.prog_name chat! I am thrilled to be able to chat together about how we can best support our children to grow up healthy and happy. Today, we are going to chat about spending One-on-One time with your children.

rows.text: Hello and thanks for being part of the@global.prog_name chat! I am thrilled to be able to chat together about how we can best support our children to grow up healthy and happy. Today, we are going to chat about spending One-on-One time with your children.

rows.title: Message 2: Introductions

text.eng: Let‚Äôs introduce ourselves! Please share your name and your goal for the programme. As an example, my name is [INSERT NAME] and I want to learn more about how to help my child go to bed by 8 every night. Feel free to add your own to the chat using text or audio message.

guidance.eng: Allow some time for parents to share.  Remember to praise each response. For example, you can say ‚ÄúThanks for the response, [Insert Name]!‚Äù or ‚ÄúGreat goal, [Insert Name]!‚Äù

rows.text: Let‚Äôs introduce ourselves! Please share your name and your goal for the programme. As an example, my name is [INSERT NAME] and I want to learn more about how to help my child go to bed by 8 every night. Feel free to add your own to the chat using text or audio message.
rows.guidance: Allow some time for parents to share.  Remember to praise each response. For example, you can say ‚ÄúThanks for the response, [Insert Name]!‚Äù or ‚ÄúGreat goal, [Insert Name]!‚Äù

rows.title: Message 3: Ground rules

text.eng:
Thanks so much for sharing! To make this a safe space to communicate openly let‚Äôs make some ground rules for this chat group. Our first rule is that what is said in the group stays in the group. You need to know that this group is private.
Here are some other examples to start us off:
- Let me know if you need to miss a chat session.
- Accept each other. Everyone is different and has different experiences.
- Share only what you feel comfortable sharing.
- Feel free to ask questions!
- Respect the privacy of personal pictures and videos that are sent to the chat group. 

Does anyone have any additional rules that they want to suggest?

guidance.eng: Allow a couple minutes for parents to share. Praise suggestions and contributions. Make sure that everyone agrees on the ground rules.

rows.text:
Thanks so much for sharing! To make this a safe space to communicate openly let‚Äôs make some ground rules for this chat group. Our first rule is that what is said in the group stays in the group. You need to know that this group is private.
Here are some other examples to start us off:
- Let me know if you need to miss a chat session.
- Accept each other. Everyone is different and has different experiences.
- Share only what you feel comfortable sharing.
- Feel free to ask questions!
- Respect the privacy of personal pictures and videos that are sent to the chat group. 

Does anyone have any additional rules that they want to suggest?
rows.guidance: Allow a couple minutes for parents to share. Praise suggestions and contributions. Make sure that everyone agrees on the ground rules.

rows.title: Message 4: Checking in on home activity

title.eng: Message 4: Checking in on home activity

text.eng:
Have you had a chance to try spending One-on-One Time with your child?
If you did, give me a thumbs up! üëç

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the thumbs up with thumbs up, emojis, or quick words of praise.

rows.text:
Have you had a chance to try spending One-on-One Time with your child?
If you did, give me a thumbs up! üëç

rows.title: Message 5: Voting on a challenge to discuss

title.eng: Message 5: Voting on a challenge to discuss

text.eng:
If you gave a thumbs up ‚Äî amazing! üéâIf you face some challenges during one-on-one time, that's completely normal. You‚Äôre not alone! Here are some common challenges caregivers have experienced. Vote for the one you‚Äôd like us to talk about together:

1Ô∏è‚É£ I didn‚Äôt have enough time
2Ô∏è‚É£ My child did not want to spend time with me
3Ô∏è‚É£ All my child wanted to do was watch TV or play with a gadget
4Ô∏è‚É£ My child wanted to do things I felt uncomfortable about

rows.text:

4Ô∏è‚É£ My child wanted to do things I felt uncomfortable about

rows.title: Message 6: Discussing solution

text.eng: Can we work together to think of a positive solution to [name challenge]?

guidance.eng: Choose the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible challenges and solutions.

rows.text: Can we work together to think of a positive solution to [name challenge]?
rows.guidance: Choose the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible challenges and solutions.

rows.title: Message 7: Open Feedback

text.eng: Thanks for discussing that challenge with me! Does anyone have any other challenges you‚Äôd like us to troubleshoot together? Feel free to share ‚Äî we‚Äôre here to support each other!

rows.text: Thanks for discussing that challenge with me! Does anyone have any other challenges you‚Äôd like us to troubleshoot together? Feel free to share ‚Äî we‚Äôre here to support each other!

rows.title: Message 8: Take a Pause

text.eng: Before we end today‚Äôs session let‚Äôs Take a Pause together. This is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or overwhelmed. I really appreciate everyone‚Äôs contribution today. I‚Äôll be in touch throughout the week with reminders about what‚Äôs coming next. Until then, have a peaceful and happy day!

text.eng: üí°Here are 5 things about how to talk about emotions with your children & your home activity for the week.

rows.title: Home practise reminder

text.eng:
Hello! Remember this week‚Äôs home practice is to try to talk about emotions with your children during one-on-one time and other times during the week. 

Talking about emotions helps children learn that all feelings are okay‚Äîeven the big or tricky ones. This makes it easier for them to understand themselves and talk to you about what they‚Äôre going through. üòäüí¨

rows.text:
Hello! Remember this week‚Äôs home practice is to try to talk about emotions with your children during one-on-one time and other times during the week. 

Talking about emotions helps children learn that all feelings are okay‚Äîeven the big or tricky ones. This makes it easier for them to understand themselves and talk to you about what they‚Äôre going through. üòäüí¨

rows.title: Chat session reminder

text.eng: Can you believe that a whole week has gone by? Our next chat session will be later at [INSERT DATE & TIME]. We will continue learning about the benefits of talking about emotions with our children. Chat soon!

rows.title: Message 1: Welcome

text.eng: Welcome to Module 2 of @global.prog_name! How is everybody doing? Happy? Stressed? Angry? Annoyed? Peaceful? Whatever emotion you feel‚Ä¶it‚Äôs okay! Please feel free to share how you are feeling today.

guidance.eng: Allow time for parents to share how they are feeling. You should also share how you are feeling. For example, ‚ÄúI am happy to be part of the chat today.‚Äù

rows.text: Welcome to Module 2 of @global.prog_name! How is everybody doing? Happy? Stressed? Angry? Annoyed? Peaceful? Whatever emotion you feel‚Ä¶it‚Äôs okay! Please feel free to share how you are feeling today.
rows.guidance: Allow time for parents to share how they are feeling. You should also share how you are feeling. For example, ‚ÄúI am happy to be part of the chat today.‚Äù

rows.title: Message 2: Checking in on home activity

title.eng: Message 2: Checking in on home activity

text.eng:
Last time, we focused on helping children talk about their feelings.
If you found a moment to talk about emotions, whether during one-on-one time or another time in the week, give me a thumbs up! üëç

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the thumbs up with thumbs up, emojis, or quick words of praise.

rows.text:
Last time, we focused on helping children talk about their feelings.
If you found a moment to talk about emotions, whether during one-on-one time or another time in the week, give me a thumbs up! üëç
rows.guidance: Acknowledge the thumbs up with thumbs up, emojis, or quick words of praise.

rows.title: Message 3: Voting on a challenge to discuss

title.eng: Message 3: Voting on a challenge to discuss

text.eng:
Great job if you were able to give it a try! üôå If starting conversations about emotions felt a bit tough, that‚Äôs totally understandable. Many parents and caregivers go through the same thing. Take a look at the challenges below and choose the one you‚Äôd like us to explore together:

1Ô∏è‚É£ My child did not want to share their feelings 
2Ô∏è‚É£ I felt uncomfortable talking about my feelings
3Ô∏è‚É£ I was afraid my child might think I am weak for sharing my own emotions
4Ô∏è‚É£I was too stressed or angry to share my emotions, I prefer to be alone when I feel like that.

rows.text:

1Ô∏è‚É£ My child did not want to share their feelings 
2Ô∏è‚É£ I felt uncomfortable talking about my feelings
3Ô∏è‚É£ I was afraid my child might think I am weak for sharing my own emotions
4Ô∏è‚É£I was too stressed or angry to share my emotions, I prefer to be alone when I feel like that.

rows.text: Can we work together to think of a positive solution to [name challenge]?
rows.guidance: Choose the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible challenges and solutions.

rows.title: Message 5: Open Feedback

text.eng: I appreciate you opening up about that! Are there any other challenging moments you‚Äôve run into? You‚Äôre welcome to bring them up, this is a space where we can help each other out.

rows.text: I appreciate you opening up about that! Are there any other challenging moments you‚Äôve run into? You‚Äôre welcome to bring them up, this is a space where we can help each other out.

rows.title: Message 6: Take a Pause

text.eng:
Before we end today‚Äôs chat session, let's Take a Pause together. Remember that this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed, or your children are annoying you. 

Thank you. The work you have done today is hard work ‚Äì but it‚Äôs also very valuable work. It will help you to manage your own stress and give your children the tools they need to manage theirs. Have a peaceful and happy day!

text.eng: Let‚Äôs see a story of parents giving praise to their child for following instructions:

rows.text: Now let‚Äôs move on to the parenting tip. Here are 3 steps to help you to get your children to follow your instructions more often:

text.eng: Now let‚Äôs move on to the parenting tip. Here are 3 steps to help you to get your children to follow your instructions more often:

rows.title: Home practise reminder

text.eng:
Hello! Keep spending 5 minutes of one-on-one time with your child every day. Remember to practice keeping your instructions positive, realistic, and specific and to praise your children for following instructions. 

Some of things you can praise your child for are playing quietly, talking respectfully to others, and helping with chores around the house. 

Thank you for your commitment and dedication to your children!

rows.text:

Some of things you can praise your child for are playing quietly, talking respectfully to others, and helping with chores around the house. 

Thank you for your commitment and dedication to your children!

title.eng: Message 2: Checking in on home activity

text.eng: How did your home practice go this week? As a reminder, for home practice you were going to practice giving specific, realistic, and positive instructions and praise your children when they followed an instruction. Give me a üëçif you were able to give it a try!

rows.text: How did your home practice go this week? As a reminder, for home practice you were going to practice giving specific, realistic, and positive instructions and praise your children when they followed an instruction. Give me a üëçif you were able to give it a try!
rows.guidance: Acknowledge the thumbs up with thumbs up, emojis, or quick words of praise.

rows.title: Message 3: Voting on a challenge to discuss

title.eng: Message 3: Voting on a challenge to discuss

text.eng:
Awesome if you had a chance to try it out! üôå If giving clear instructions or remembering to praise your child feels a bit challenging, you‚Äôre not alone. Many caregivers find this takes practice. Check out the challenges below and pick the one you‚Äôd like us to talk through together:

1Ô∏è‚É£ My child did not follow my instructions, even when I used the tips. 
2Ô∏è‚É£ I forgot to praise my child. 
3Ô∏è‚É£ I shouted at my child when they behaved negatively instead of giving them a positive instruction for what they should do.
4Ô∏è‚É£ It is hard to remember to use positive words when giving instructions.

rows.text:
Awesome if you had a chance to try it out! üôå If giving clear instructions or remembering to praise your child feels a bit challenging, you‚Äôre not alone. Many caregivers find this takes practice. Check out the challenges below and pick the one you‚Äôd like us to talk through together:

1Ô∏è‚É£ My child did not follow my instructions, even when I used the tips. 
2Ô∏è‚É£ I forgot to praise my child. 
3Ô∏è‚É£ I shouted at my child when they behaved negatively instead of giving them a positive instruction for what they should do.
4Ô∏è‚É£ It is hard to remember to use positive words when giving instructions.

rows.title: Message 4: Discussing solution

text.eng: Can we work together to think of a positive solution to [name challenge]?

guidance.eng: Choose the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible challenges and solutions.

rows.text: Can we work together to think of a positive solution to [name challenge]?
rows.guidance: Choose the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible challenges and solutions.

rows.title: Message 5: Open Feedback

text.eng: Thanks for sharing that! Have you come across any other difficult situations lately? Feel free to share, this is a space where we can support one another.

rows.text: Thanks for sharing that! Have you come across any other difficult situations lately? Feel free to share, this is a space where we can support one another.

rows.title: Message 6: Take a Pause

text.eng:
Before we end today‚Äôs module, let's Take a Pause together. Remember that this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed, or your children are annoying you.

Thank you for working as hard as you do as parents. The commitment you are showing to improving the lives of your children just by being here is worth the final note of praise in our module today: Truly well done.

text.eng: Now let‚Äôs move on to today‚Äôs parent tip. Here are 4 steps you can take to help your children follow household rules and routines:

rows.title: Home practise reminder

text.eng:
Hello! You should try to involve your children and other members of your household when making new rules and routines. These can be around bedtime, schoolwork or chores. 

It is perfectly normal for children to test out rules before making them a normal part of the routine. Soon these rules and routines will just feel like a normal part of your household and day. Daily routines can help create a sense of security in the household. 

Thank you!

rows.text:
Hello! You should try to involve your children and other members of your household when making new rules and routines. These can be around bedtime, schoolwork or chores. 

It is perfectly normal for children to test out rules before making them a normal part of the routine. Soon these rules and routines will just feel like a normal part of your household and day. Daily routines can help create a sense of security in the household. 

Thank you!

rows.title: Message 3: Voting on a challenge to discuss

title.eng: Message 3: Voting on a challenge to discuss

text.eng:
Great if you were able to give it a go! üôå If coming up with a household rule or setting a routine felt a little tough, you‚Äôre definitely not the only one. Lots of caregivers are figuring it out too. Take a look at the challenges below and choose the one you‚Äôd like us to chat about together:

1Ô∏è‚É£We were not able to stick to the rule
2Ô∏è‚É£My child and I could not agree on a rule
3Ô∏è‚É£I felt uncomfortable, because I feel parents should be the one establishing the rule not my child
4Ô∏è‚É£Another caregiver at home didn‚Äôt agree with the rule

Thank you so much for a wonderful session. I hope the rules and routines you introduce into your homes help make your household more manageable. Have a peaceful and happy day!

üëã Welcome to Module 5 of @global.app_name! This week, we‚Äôll talk about positive discipline ‚Äì calm, practical and positive ways to respond when our children misbehave. It‚Äôs not about letting children do whatever they want. Positive discipline helps us guide our children while building a stronger relationship.

text.eng: üëã Welcome to Module 5 of @global.app_name! This week, we‚Äôll talk about positive discipline ‚Äì calm, practical and positive ways to respond when our children misbehave. It‚Äôs not about letting children do whatever they want. Positive discipline helps us guide our children while building a stronger relationship.

rows.title: Home practise reminder

text.eng: Hello! Remember that using new ways to discipline your children takes practice! Try to make sure that consequences should be fair and realistic. They are best used when your child forgets a household rule or refuses to follow an instruction.

rows.text: Hello! Remember that using new ways to discipline your children takes practice! Try to make sure that consequences should be fair and realistic. They are best used when your child forgets a household rule or refuses to follow an instruction.

rows.title: Home practise reminder

text.eng: It is really important to remember to Keep It Positive! Continue to spend quality time with your children, use positive instructions, and praise them when they are behaving well. The more positive attention they receive for good behaviour, the less you will have to discipline them!

rows.text: It is really important to remember to Keep It Positive! Continue to spend quality time with your children, use positive instructions, and praise them when they are behaving well. The more positive attention they receive for good behaviour, the less you will have to discipline them!

üëãWelcome to our last week of @global.app_name! Today we are going to learn about how to solve problems with our children and reflect on what we have learned in the programme.

text.eng: üëãWelcome to our last week of @global.app_name! Today we are going to learn about how to solve problems with our children and reflect on what we have learned in the programme.

rows.text: Let‚Äôs look at a story about how you can work with your children to find a solution to a problem instead of having to use consequences:

text.eng: Let‚Äôs look at a story about how you can work with your children to find a solution to a problem instead of having to use consequences:

rows.text: Let's look at how a situation when our children get bullied by others online:

text.eng: Let's look at how a situation when our children get bullied by others online:

rows.text: Now let‚Äôs move on to the final parenting tip on problem solving with your children. We have been doing this throughout the programme. Now it is time to learn how we can involve our children in the process! Here are the 4 basic steps for problem solving:

text.eng: Now let‚Äôs move on to the final parenting tip on problem solving with your children. We have been doing this throughout the programme. Now it is time to learn how we can involve our children in the process! Here are the 4 basic steps for problem solving:

rows.title: Reminder of skills

text.eng: Congratulations! I wanted to share an audio message that might help you reflect on all of the things we explored in the @global_app.name programme.

guidance.eng: Send this message with the audio recording

rows.text: Congratulations! I wanted to share an audio message that might help you reflect on all of the things we explored in the @global_app.name programme.
rows.guidance: Send this message with the audio recording

rows.title: Reminder of home activities

text.eng:
Even though the programme is ending soon, our parenting work continues! Remember to continue practising all of the skills that we have learned together. The main ones are:

1Ô∏è‚É£Spend one-on-one time with your children. Just 5 minutes a day can make a difference

2Ô∏è‚É£Praise your children when they are behaving well

3Ô∏è‚É£Keep it positive with positive instructions

4Ô∏è‚É£Have consistent household rules and daily routines (including time for play!)

5Ô∏è‚É£Practice positive discipline with redirect and consequences

6Ô∏è‚É£Involve  your child in solving problems together.

7Ô∏è‚É£Take 5 deep breaths or a Pause when you are feeling stressed or angry.

rows.text:

6Ô∏è‚É£Involve  your child in solving problems together.

7Ô∏è‚É£Take 5 deep breaths or a Pause when you are feeling stressed or angry.

text.eng: Welcome to Module 6 of @global.app_name! How is everybody doing? Describe what you are feeling today, where you feel it in your body and what thoughts you associate with the feeling.

guidance.eng: Allow time for parents to share. You should also share how you are feeling. For example, ‚ÄúI am excited to be part of the chat today, and I feel that excitement in my heart.‚Äù

rows.text: Welcome to Module 6 of @global.app_name! How is everybody doing? Describe what you are feeling today, where you feel it in your body and what thoughts you associate with the feeling.
rows.guidance: Allow time for parents to share. You should also share how you are feeling. For example, ‚ÄúI am excited to be part of the chat today, and I feel that excitement in my heart.‚Äù

rows.title: Message 2: Reflection

text.eng: Since we are having our last chat session, let‚Äôs take a few moments to reflect on our experience during the programme. Let‚Äôs share some of the things that we learned from the programme or ways that we and our children have changed.

guidance.eng: Give parents time to reflect and respond. You can encourage everyone to have a chance to write something in the chat. Remember to thank each parent for their contribution. If no parents respond, you can prompt by asking parents to share something they are proud of, or something that surprised them.

rows.guidance: Give parents time to reflect and respond. You can encourage everyone to have a chance to write something in the chat. Remember to thank each parent for their contribution. If no parents respond, you can prompt by asking parents to share something they are proud of, or something that surprised them.

rows.title: Message 3: Stone Soup

text.eng: Thank you for sharing. Now you can sit back and enjoy a story that we have shared at the end of all of our parenting programmes.

rows.text: Thank you for sharing. Now you can sit back and enjoy a story that we have shared at the end of all of our parenting programmes.

rows.title: Message 4: Discussion about the stone soup

title.eng: Message 4: Discussion about the stone soup

text.eng: What are some of the ingredients that we have in our group to continue supporting us as parents? In what ways can we continue to support each other after the end of the programme?

guidance.eng: Remember to give parents a chance to respond before moving on to the reflection

rows.text: What are some of the ingredients that we have in our group to continue supporting us as parents? In what ways can we continue to support each other after the end of the programme?
rows.guidance: Remember to give parents a chance to respond before moving on to the reflection

rows.title: Message 5: Offer for Questions about ongoing support through the group

title.eng: Message 5: Offer for Questions about ongoing support through the group

text.eng: Thank you to [Insert Name of New Group Administrator] who will be taking over as the group administrator. Do any of you have any questions about how you can continue to use the group going forward?

guidance.eng: Allow a few minutes for parents to raise any questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions and let them take the lead in the ongoing planning for the group.

rows.text: Thank you to [Insert Name of New Group Administrator] who will be taking over as the group administrator. Do any of you have any questions about how you can continue to use the group going forward?
rows.guidance: Allow a few minutes for parents to raise any questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions and let them take the lead in the ongoing planning for the group.

rows.title: Message 6: Thank you & closing

text.eng:
Let‚Äôs close with an activity that is similar to Taking a Pause. Since it is the last module of the programme, we take this opportunity to reconnect with ourselves and our families through a sense of love and support.

Thank you and well done for completing the ParentChat programme! You have shown great love and commitment to your families by being here. It has been a pleasure to be on this journey with you.
